meanings.definition: A tree of the mulberry family, with large leaves, sweet fruit, and a thick trunk.
meanings.sent1: The figtrees in the park provide shade on hot days.
meanings.sent2: I love sitting under the figtrees in my backyard and reading a book.
meanings.sent3: The figtrees in the garden seem to whisper secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a forest of figtrees, each thought a ripe fruit waiting to be picked.
meanings.sent5: The figtrees stood tall and proud, their branches reaching towards the sky.

meanings.definition: The fruit of a figtree, which is typically purple or green and has a sweet flavor.
meanings.sent1: She picked a ripe fig from the figtrees in the orchard.
meanings.sent2: The figtrees in the backyard are full of delicious fruit this year.
meanings.sent3: The figtrees at the market looked so tempting, she couldn't resist buying some.
meanings.sent4: His words were like figtrees, sweet and satisfying to the soul.
meanings.sent5: The figtrees in the painting seemed almost lifelike, their colors vibrant and inviting.
